final_answer.precision_note: 3 significant figures based on limiting data (0.150 mol dm-3).

method: Calculate moles of NaOH: n = c * V = 0.150 * 0.02340 = 0.00351 mol. Reaction H2SO4 + 2NaOH -> Na2SO4 + 2H2O shows 2 moles NaOH react with 1 mole H2SO4. Moles H2SO4 = 0.00351 / 2 = 0.001755 mol. Concentration of H2SO4 = n / V = 0.001755 / 0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
